resources.string:
In Forza Horizon 4 main characteristics: Speed and Control. Most of the opponent's overtaking takes place in corners, where the stability of the car is important. Therefore always:
 Control > Speed.

 The balance between these 2 indicators works according to the system of hidden points. You have only 10 points that you can spend, and if you put 8 points in Speed, in Control you can only invest the remaining 2.

 Upgrades occurs in the following order:
 Conversation -> Aerodynamic ->
 Tyres -> Drivetrain -> Platform and Handling -> Engine

Tune of the car is done after installing all the necessary racing components. Fine tuning allows you to tailor the car to your needs and desires. The following instructions are averaged in this menu. These instructions are designed to help you understand the effects of sliders.

\tThe engine is recommended to leave the serial. Replacement makes sense only if you switch to another class. It is not recommended to install the most powerful engine available, it may become redundant for your car. It is very important to maintain a balance between power and handling. Excessive power leads to loss of control.
Traction is higher than that of a rear-wheel drive car
- All-wheel drive it is recommended for such types of races as: Dirt Racing Series, Cross Country Series, Street Scene, Road Racing Series, The Drag Strip.
- Rear drive it is recommended for such types of races as: Street Scene, Road Racing Series, Drift, The Drag Strip.
- Front-wheel drive not recommended for use.
\tIf the factory engine is missing Turbocharger or Supercharger, they are not recommended for installation, the use of Turbocharger or Supercharger gives too many points of a car class:
There is a drop in engine speed

\tAppearance components should only be installed if branded or fully-equipped body kits from the CONVERSATION tab are present. Details from Forza Horizon are set at the discretion of the user, they do not give significant bonuses and, according to players, on most cars, they look unsuccessful.
\tThe compound of the tires depends on the type of race in which you will participate:

1) Dirt Racing Series и Cross Country Series - tyres for off-road racing.
2) The Drag Strip - tyres for drag-racing.
3) Drift - tyre racing.
4) Street Scene and Road Racing Series - tyre racing.
1) Front tyres - it is recommended to establish the medium indicators of width\n2) Back tyres - it is recommended to establish the maximum indicators of width.
\tThe style of the rims does not affect anything, install as desired.
\tRims size does not affect anything, install as desired.
\tThe distance between the front and rear wheels is always maximum, the wider the car, the greater its stability.
\tIt is recommended to set the racing level - reduces weight, reduces switching time.
\tIt is recommended that you set a racing level.
\tThe type of springs and shock absorbers completely depends on the type of races in which you will participate:

1) Dirt Racing Series and Cross Country Series - S/D for off-road racing.
2) The Drag Strip - racing springs and shock absorbers.
3) Drift - S/D for drift.
4) Street Scene и Road Racing Series - racing springs and shock absorbers.
\tSet racing level - unlocks front and rear cross adjustment.
\tSet a sporting level - a racing level adds a lot of extra weight to the car.
\tIt is recommended to set a sports level - the racing level gives too many class points.\n\tIdeal weight of the car for races Drift-race, Street spirit, Highway series is 1000 ~ 1300 kg.

Install engine parts in the last turn, provided that their installation does not increase the class of the car, so we consume all the remaining points of the class without moving to a higher one. We install in the following order:
1) Flywheel - racing level
2) Intake - street level
3) Exhaust - street level
4) Ignition - sports level
5) Pistons/Compression
6) Displacement
7) Fuel system
8) Valves
9) Camshaft
10) Turbocharger/Supercharger
\tThe first step is to set the average tire pressure. The pressure depends on the type of race in which you will participate and coverage which you will ride:

\tTire pressure significantly affects driving performance. Weak pressure leads to insufficient acceleration and insufficient maximum speed. Strong pressure results in poor stability and poor handling. It is also important to consider that at high speed, the temperature inside the wheel increases, which in turn increases the pressure by another 0.2 atmosphere.

\tNext, you need to go to the site used in future coverage (soil or asphalt), open Telemetry (Button T), open the tab Heat, continue to accelerate, brake sharply, turn, skid and monitor the color of the tires when driving:
Orange - tire pressure is too high, reduce.
Blue - tire pressure is too low; increase is required.
Reduce or increase the pressure, until the tires are white in most cases.
Choose a race type and \nclick \"Get result\"

string-array.name: array_pokritie
string-array.item: Choose a race type from the list

resources.string: Choose a race type and \nclick \"Get result\"

Required to go to a straight section of the road, start driving and look at the behavior of the first gear before switching to 2nd:
 1) The speedometer needle beats into the cutoff - the gear ratio is too large, you need to shift the 1st gear indicator to the left, towards the speed.
 2) The speedometer needle rises very slowly - the gear ratio is too small, you need to shift the 1st gear indicator to the right, towards acceleration.
 When the 1st gear is adjusted, the arrow will smoothly rise and stand still until shifting to 2nd gear.
\tYou need to open any tab in the modification of the car engine and remember at what speed, the engine gives the maximum torque (the top point of the green graph).
\tAfter matching with the speed indicators grid, in the Fine-tuning gears. Switching to 2nd gear should occur at the highest torque.

\tNext, you need to set the gear values so that each subsequent gear changes at slightly higher speed than the previous one, as well as all gears should be visible on the grid and end exactly at the end of it.\n\tThis can be achieved by adjusting the sliders of all gears and sliders the Final Drive slider towards Speed or Acceleration.

\tThe collapse is configured on the ring road, by Telemetry(Button T) in the tab Tyres, Misc..\n Having left the ring, you need to start moving clockwise, accelerate to 100 \- 150 km/h(60 \- 100 mi/h), start looking at the camber of the left front and left rear wheels, depending on the value, adjust the slider to the right (positive) or left (negative) side, when turning, a camber angle of close to 0 degrees is required. Then, in the same way, but counterclockwise, we adjust the right wheels.

\tBefore fine-tuning, average values must be set. Enter the minimum and maximum values for the position of the sliders at the left and right points, in each tab. The values will be automatically calculated, you only need to apply them.But before starting the calculation, you need to set the value of Weight Front Distribution of the car, it can be found in the information about the car in the Garage:

\tRequired to go to the circle, open Telemetry(Button T), the Suspension tab, start moving in a circle and adjust the sliders Anti-roll bars so that Rebound Stiffness is close to 80%, then continue to adjust until a result is obtained that allows constant driving in a circle without releasing gas or close to this result, in case of lack of control, then you need to make the transverse softer if excess is tougher.
\tRequired to go straight, open Telemetry(Button T), the Suspension tab, start straight ahead and adjust Springs so that Rebound Stiffness is close to 80%
1) Asphalt - 4 clicks from the minimum value.\n2) Primer coating - maximum value.

\tRequired to go to go on the road with the presence of bumps, holes, potholes, bumps, open Telemetry(Button T), the Suspension tab, start straight ahead and adjust Springs so that Rebound Stiffness is close to 80%.
\tSpecify the set values in the Rebound Stiffness paragraph in the input fields, and the Bump Stiffness values will be automatically calculated for you:
Downforce adjustment only opens after installing body kits
1) Front - set to 60 \- 70% towards the turn.
2) Rear - set to maximum in the direction of the turn.
1) The balance is responsible for the rims during braking, you only need to adjust if you are not comfortable with the front or rear wheels when braking.

The availability of differential adjustment depends on the drive of the vehicle.
Four-wheel drive - front and rear differentials.
Front-wheel drive - only the front differential.
 Rear-wheel drive is only the rear differential.
